Instrument.name: Mars Exploration Rover Spirit Radio Science Subsystem
Instrument.description: The Mars Exploration Rover (MER) mission included two spacecraft, Spirit (MER 2) and Opportunity (MER 1). The MER Radio Science data consisted of measurements of the Doppler shift of the rover radio signal as measured by the NASA Deep Space Network (DSN) and by the Mars Odyssey orbiter (ODY). The primary purpose of all equipment was collection of telemetry from the rovers, with Doppler measurements made for rover position determination as required and on a best efforts basis to support Radio Science. The performance and calibration of both the spacecraft and tracking stations directly affected the radio science data accuracy, and they played a major role in determining the quality of the results.
